t: Psalm 107
O*p give thanks unto the Lord,*s for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
Let*p the redeemed of the Lord*s say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;
And*p gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.
They*p wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.
Hungry*p and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
Then*p they cried unto the Lord*s in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
And*p he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
Oh*p that men would praise the Lord*s for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
For*p he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
Such*p as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;
Because*p they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:
Therefore*p he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.
Then*p they cried unto the Lord*s in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
He*p brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.
Oh*p that men would praise the Lord*s for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
For*p he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.
Fools*p because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
Their*p soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.
Then*p they cry unto the Lord*s in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.
He*p sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.
Oh*p that men would praise the Lord*s for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
And*p let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.
They*p that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;
These*p see the works of the Lord,*s and his wonders in the deep.
For*p he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.
They*p mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.
They*p reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits' end.
Then*p they cry unto the Lord*s in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.
He*p maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.
Then*p are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
Oh*p that men would praise the Lord*s for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
Let*p them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
He*p turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;
A*p fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
He*p turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.
And*p there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;
And*p sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.
He*p blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
Again,*p they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.
He*p poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
Yet*p setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.
The*p righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
Whoso*p is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the Lord.*s
